primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God actively dismantles human religious systems to bestow mercy on the helpless and ungodly through the death of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has consigned all human beings to disobedience
He has arrived with salvation for all
in order that he may have mercy upon all
he would have given you living water

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (Scripture as the voice)

ontvanger.identificatie: The Ungodly / The Helpless / All Humanity
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly moved from 'Subject of religion' to 'Receiver of mercy'.

tekstueel_bewijs: only the Holy Spirit fully knows
the word Jesus has spoken to her
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power that subverts human expectations.

tekstueel_bewijs: struggle to think well of ourselves
the nerve center... is the exact opposite of the good old American gospel
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Religion is framed as a deceptive system that attempts to put God in debt, requiring a divine 'No' to dismantle.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to reach God through religion (The 'American Gospel').
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Religious Person
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher argues that the secondary program (religion) is a false narrative that must be 'put out of business' by the primary program (grace).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has consigned all human beings to disobedience
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we perform our religious and moral duties
we are constantly slipping back into religion

voorbeelden: struggle to think well of ourselves
If you knew who it is
He would have given you living water

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (helplessness) met by Divine 'pouvoir' (mercy). It rejects 'devoir' (moralism).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Religion) to S2 (Universal Disobedience) to S1 (Universal Mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'consigning' all to S2 so that S1 can be given as a gift.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; sin is seen as a state of helplessness, not just mistakes.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is radically theocentric. It explicitly attacks anthropocentric religion and places all agency in God's hands.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: None found; the sermon explicitly refutes 'God helps those who help themselves'.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has consigned all human beings to disobedience

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as recipients of grace, not models of behavior.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Abraham (as one who trusted God who justifies the ungodly)
Samaritan Woman (as a recipient of living water)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: God saves the Samaritan woman despite her status.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'endless struggle' of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrated; the rejection of religion is the necessary precursor to the proclamation of grace.
spanning_punten: The 'No' of God vs the 'Yes' of God

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: His condemnation becomes our everlasting redemption.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit makes the subversive sermon operative in the hearer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total helplessness; 'none righteous, no, not one'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is a 'Subject-Switch' where the hearer is fired from the role of Subject (Religion) and rehired as Receiver (Grace).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a 'pure' grace sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent (Religion/Sin) is already treated as an insurmountable barrier for humans.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology is the foundation; ethics are not even mentioned to avoid confusing the actants.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of Greimassian grace-oriented structure. It successfully maintains God as the Subject of all transformative verbs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Samaritan woman' imagery; semiotics reveals the underlying 'Subject-Object' reversal.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 11; semiotics shows how the sermon functions as a 'speech act' that consigns the hearer to mercy.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps identify that 'Religion' is the 'Opponent' actant here, which is a sophisticated structural move.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'American Gospel' as a foil to define the true Actantial Subject (God).
